summary: Dar es Salaam is the biggest city in Tanzania and East Africa, with over five million people. It's an important economic center and one of the world's fastest-growing cities. Founded in the 1860s by Sultan Majid bin Said, it served as the main administrative and commercial hub for German East Africa, Tanganyika, and Tanzania. Though the capital moved to Dodoma in 1996, Dar es Salaam remains Tanzania's leader in arts, fashion, media, and finance. The city is divided into five districts.
title: Dar es Salaam
